sections.heading: Data Collection and Storage
content: All journal entries and brain dump entries you create are stored securely on your device using Apple’s SwiftData framework. Your data is not uploaded to any external server.
If you attach photos to an entry, those images are stored locally on your device.
App preferences (such as theme choices, selected affirmation categories, or button colors) are stored locally using Apple’s AppStorage (UserDefaults).

sections.heading: Data Sharing
content: The app retrieves affirmation data and button color themes from publicly available sources on GitHub. No personal or journal data is sent during these requests.
The app does not share, sell, or transmit your personal data to any third parties.

sections.heading: Analytics & Tracking
content: The app does not use analytics services, advertising networks, or tracking technologies.

sections.heading: Permissions
content: The app does not request access to contacts, location, microphone, or other sensitive device features.
If the app requires access to your photos for attaching them to journal entries, that access is strictly for saving and displaying your own images within the app.

sections.heading: Your Control
content: All your data (entries, photos, preferences) remains on your device. If you delete the app, your data will be erased from your device.
You can delete journal entries and photos at any time.

sections.heading: Changes to This Policy
content: If this policy is updated, you will be notified through the app or via an app update.

sections.heading: Contact
content: If you have questions regarding privacy or your data, please contact: [your contact email here].
